stock-in-trade.translation[0].definition: something that is typical of a particular person or thing, especially what they say or do
Stewart’s stock-in-trade was the face-to-face interview.
the things you need to do your job
Vanessa’s looks have been her stock-in-trade as an actress.
stock-in-trade.translation[1].definition: all the goods that a company has to sell, as well as the raw materials that it uses to produce these
When you start up a business, you need sufficient funds to purchase your stock-in-trade.
words or behaviour that are typical of someone
politicians whose stock-in-trade is economic populism
After he finished his apprenticeship, kitchens became a part of his stock-in-trade.
